p: Furthermore, the Hospital Universitario de Canarias and the Izaña Atmospheric Research Centre found that hospital admissions due to heart failure are associated to exposure to ultrafine particles ( Domínguez-Rodríguez et al., 2011), whereas black carbon has been associated with Acute Coronary Syndrome ( Domínguez-Rodríguez et al., 2016). Other studies have also observed relationships between NO 2 and the ejection capacity of the heart ( Dominguez-Rodriguez et al., 2013a) and between SO 2 and obstructive lesions and Acute Coronary Syndrome ( Domínguez-Rodríguez et al., 2013b).
